column5: I would guess about 150 days or so, if you can count chuckin' spoons off the lakeshore in Mississauga with not a hope in hell but just getting my line wet.  Minus those excursions, I would estimate about 75 days of QUALITY time on the water.  Man, I can't wait to retire and I'm only 26! lol  I envy most of you.  reefrunner

Ya, I have a flexable career. Sponsered by a few shops helps. Most of the time I am fishing, I am really woking. To add to that, no wife or kids (wouldn't have time for that), just married to fishing and the job. No don't have a place on the water but have a few places in Hamilton to fish and test carp gear.  If Im ever lucky to get married and have kids   , than the 203 days will be 50 or so.LOL  Daniel OCH
I would estimate 30-40 times in 2007 and that was my best year. For 2008 I hope to top that with some more shore fishing/river walking. -Brian
Last time I did a fish log (kept track of every fishing trip in a journal) I did like 268. That was a couple of years ago.. don't fish so much now.. maybe only 200
about 40
Very close to 210 days / 07. Mmmmm, yes full time retirement is as wonderful as they say.
I hear ya, 20 to 30 days at best for me...

seeing as your counting a few hours after work(3or4)and 2-3 hrs in the morn before work im fishing about 200 + days a year.our ice fishing season on the BOQ started dec 4th for us and sense then ive missed 9 days  ,due to white outs and a warm spell we had great post i enjoyed reading all your posts.  Hawg Hunter

About how many days a year do you guys fish?  I have a little calendar in my lunchbox where I write down the overtime I work.  This year I started to also mark down each day I that I fish.  I'm at 14 as of today, it'll be 16 by Sunday.  I think it's possible I will exceed 100.  I remember reading in In-Fisherman that Al Lindner fished about 230 days a year, if any of you folks are anywhere near big Al, I take my hat off to you.
I probably fish 50 to 100 times a year. It would be far greater if I owned a boat.
I did the same thing with my PDA and last year with no ice fishing. I fished 203 days open water. If I did ice fish it would be more. Haven't check yet for 2008.  Fish Hard!! Daniel OCH
bonghitts,now thats a great handle!!!!
Its too bad you decided to slam him rather than answer a perfectly fine question about fishing.

OntCarp is the King!  Are you retired?  Do you own a house on the water?  How do you do it, man?  My wife lets me fish as much as I want...we have no kids yet, but having to show up at work 5 days a week really gets in the way of wetting a line.  As far as my handle goes...when I chose it I didn't realize this was a "family" oriented site.  Am I going to get in trouble?  I tried, but I can't figure out how to change it.
Mods can change it for you  live and learn.

I hardly ice fish, but basically every other day from Walleye opener to ice up, so from May 1st to Dec ? . Wow that would only be a little over 100 so to get 200 in open water season it would have to be every day almost from opener to ice on average in Ontario.

I don't keep track.. maybe I should start. Last year.. somewhere around a 120 days.  As for your handle.. go to "my controls" and if you want you can change it there... not that there's any real need. There's worse around here...
What do you want to be called, I'll change it for you.
I figure I average a little better then a day a week...so maybe 70 days a year. When I am retired I count on that doubling!!!
I'm happy with Bonghitts to be honest, but I don't want to be a bad role model to "the kids" or anything.  Do you think a name change is prudent, Roy?
Do what you like Bud, was just trying to help.
Im going to guess around a hundred days(lots during salmon season) I'm going to try and keep track from now on. I'd lose count on the bong hits.

Thank you Roy.  I appreciate your help.  I'm new here and not sure what kind of sense of humor the community has.  Considering we're all fishermen, I guess I don't have to worry about anyone being too uptight.  Those of us that have tapped the source can't be bothered to fuss over the little things, am I right?

When I was in between wives like 4 or 5 days a week late March thru November, a lot of it was after work in the dark! Learned to like night fishing! Now a lot less, like once, still fished a lot until illness hit.
doesn't anyone work  I don't keep track, as many days as I can I get out

In the summer I fish every day the winds allow, less after October until ice season. In the spring I am fishing every second day when the walleye are in the river. That being said it is likely an average on 52 days a year.
Hmm I would say anywhere around 70 times for me...
Over the past 3 years my range has been 72-117, 72 was in 05, and I was dissapointed lol, 117 was in 06 in it was the best
while im working up north guiding probably 130 days x 7-10hrs a day from may till october ,,then maybe 10 days ice fishing ..so about 140 days a year,,,the rest of my days are spent snowmobiling
I am jealous Carl.Wow little ...............
But Wayne that just doesn't add up to the fishin reports and fish pics  I hope to see more reports this year and its OK if the family out fishes you
Been told today Mike ?
